title: Drawing, 1910–11
medium: Brush and green, ice blue and royal blue watercolor and gouache on white wove paper
inscribed:
Roman Numeral I in graphite on royal blue ground at right; Roman numeral II written in graphite on green band on flower at center and on leaf at right; the letter H in graphite on light portion of large bell shaped flower at center. 

Inscription on mount: in pen and black ink, lower right under sheet: Dessin: "Bavaria"
On mount upper right in blue crayon: 152
On mount lower right stamp: Wiener / Werk / Statte
creditline: Museum purchase from Smithsonian Collections Acquisition and Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Funds
description:
Pale blue and light green bell shaped florwers, leaves and vines on a dark blue ground. Roman numerals are written on the pattern in graphite.
(Colorway: green, ice blue, royal blue)

exhibitions.title: Multiple Choice: From Sample to Product

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1910–11.
1910–11. Brush and green, ice blue and royal blue watercolor and gouache on white wove paper. Museum purchase from Smithsonian Collections Acquisition and Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Funds. 1988-62-54.
